HL7 Standard.summary: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) Implementation Guide is fundamentally based on FHIR, using it as the core standard for defining resources, operations, and interactions. It leverages FHIR's RESTful capabilities and profiling mechanisms to create a standardized approach for exchanging referral information. While it acknowledges other HL7 standards, they are not central to its design or implementation.

Geographic Scope.summary: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) Implementation Guide is explicitly stated as a U.S. Realm Specification and is based on reporting specifications in U.S. jurisdictions. It builds upon US Core and references other U.S.-centric standards. Therefore, it is classified as a National Implementation Guide for the United States.

Domain Focus.summary: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) IG primarily focuses on streamlining and standardizing the referral process between healthcare providers and community-based organizations, particularly for chronic health conditions. It emphasizes workflow management and care coordination through a closed-loop referral system, leveraging FHIR R4 and building upon US Core. While clinical data is exchanged, the focus is on the referral process itself, making workflow and care planning the core domains.

Implementers.summary: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) IG primarily targets EHR systems and systems used by Community-Based Organizations (CBOs) for managing referrals. EHR systems will initiate and receive feedback on referrals, while CBO systems will receive and process referrals, providing feedback.  Clinical Decision Support systems may play a role in identifying patients needing referrals. Payer systems have minimal involvement, primarily related to potential authorization requirements. Public Health and Research systems may utilize aggregated data from these referrals for population health analysis and research purposes, respectively. Pharmacy and Imaging systems are not directly involved in the core referral process defined by this IG.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: The Bidirectional Services eReferral (BSeR) IG primarily focuses on facilitating communication and coordination between healthcare providers and community-based organizations (CBOs) for chronic condition management. Clinical Care Teams are the core users, driving the design with their need for a closed-loop referral process. Healthcare Administrators and Public Health Agencies have significant influence due to their roles in managing referrals and monitoring population health, respectively. Payers and Government Agencies have a defined but limited role, primarily related to reimbursement and regulatory compliance. Research Organizations and Patients/Caregivers have minimal involvement in this specific IG.
